page.title: 15LANDSCAPE..FARM BUILDINGS
page.content: The 75 acre farm at St. Mary's lies tucked away discreetly in the lowest part of the valley.The buildings which date from the middle of the 19th century are in a good state of repair and the whole farm has been put under a conservation order as a list"B" building.The layout of the courtyard, the attractive red pan tile roofs, the original roof timbers and the total absence of modern structures combine to make the farm most interesting. Originally the land was worked by the farmer and one labourer,the 75 acres being the area they could manage with horse and plough.The original fields are still in existence though the land is now owned and worked by a neighbouring farmer.It is to be hoped that St.Mary's will still be intact in 50 years time.
